gurmukhi: sXwm BnY Aiq Awhv mY muslI Aru BUpq kop Bry hY ] Awps bIc hkwr doaU Bt ic`q ibKY nhI nYk fry hY ]
transliteration: Syaan Bhanai At(i) Aahav Mai Mousliar(u) Bhoopat Kop Bhare Hai|| Oopas Beech Hakaar Dooo Bhat Chitt Bikhai Nahinaik Dare Hai||
translation: According to the poet, both Balram and Jarashand are full of rage in the war-arena; both are challenging one another and are not afraid of the other even slightly;

gurmukhi: BwrI gdw gih hwQn mY rn BUmh qy nih pYgu try hY ] mwnhu m`D mhwNbn ky pl ky ihq hÍY br isMG Ary hY ]1876]
transliteration: Bhaarigadaa Gadh Haathan Mai Ran Bhoomah Te Nah(i) Paig(u) Dare Hai|| Maanoh Maddh Mahaanban Ke Pal Ke Hit Hvai Har Singhdare Hai||1876||
translation: Catching hold of huge maces, both are not taking one step backward in the battlefield; they appear like lion ready for hunting.1876.

gurmukhi: kwit gdw bldyv deI iqh BUpq kI Aru bwnn mwrXo ] paurK XwhI iBrXo hm so irs kY Air kau ieh BwNiq pcwrXo ]
transliteration: Kaat(i) Gadaa Baldev Daitih Bhoopat Kiar(u) Baanan Mdaryo|| Paurakh Yaahibhiryo Ham So Ris Kai Ar(i) Kau Eh Bhaant(i) Pachdaryo||
translation: Balram cut down the mace of the king and shot arrows at him; he said to him, “Did you fight with me on the strength of this thought of bravery?”

gurmukhi: ieau kih kY pun bwnin mwr srwsn lY iqh gRIvih fwrXo ] dyv krY aupmw su khY jdubIr ijqXo su bfo Air hwrXo ]1877]
transliteration: Io Kah(i) Kai Poun Baanan(i) Maar Saraasan Lai Tih Greevah(i) Ddaryo|| Dev Darai Oupmaa Jadoubeer Jityo Su Bado Ar(i) Hdaryo||1877||
translation: Saying this and discharging his arrows, Balram put his bow around the neck of the king; Balram, the hero of Yadavas won in this war and that formidable enemy was defeated.1877.

gurmukhi: kMpq ho ijh qy su KgyS mhyS munI ijh qy BY BIqXo ] SyS jlyS idnyS insyS suryS huqy icq mY n ncIqXo ]
transliteration: Kanpat Ho Jih Te Su Khagesh Mahesh Mounndjih Te Bhai Bheetyo|| Shesh Jalesh Dinesh Nisesh Suresh Houte Chit Mai Na Nacheetyo||
translation: He, from whom, the king of birds Garuda and the god Shiva tremble; he, from whom the sages, Sheshnaga, Varuna, Surya, Chandra, Indra etc. all of them are afraid in their mind;

gurmukhi: qw niRp ky isr pY kib sXwm khY ieh kwl ieso Ab bIqXo ] DMnih DMnu khY sB sUr Bly Bgvwn bfo Air jIqXo ]1878]
transliteration: To Nrip Ke Sir Pai Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Kaal Iso Ab Beetyo|| Dhannah(i) Dhann(u) Kahai Sabh Soor Bhale Bhagvaan Bado Ar(i) Jeetyo||1878||
translation: On the head of that king now hovered Kal (Death); all the warriors hailing Krishna said this, “By the grace of Krishna the great enemies have been conquered.”1878.

gurmukhi: blBdR gdw gihkY ieq qy irs swQ khXo Air kau hirhO ] ieh pRwn bcwvq ko hm so jm jau iBir hY n qaU firhO ]
transliteration: Balbhadra Gadaa Gadh Kai It Te Ris Saath Kahyo Ar(i) Kau Harihau|| Eh Praan Badhaavadko Ham So Jam Jau Bhir(i) Hai Na Taoo Darihau||
translation: Balram, holding the mace in his hand, in great fury, said, “I shall kill the enemy; if even Yama comes to protect his life, then I shall also fight with him;

gurmukhi: Gwin sXwm sBY sMg jwdv lY qij Xwh khY n BXw tirho ] kib sXwm khY muslI ieh BwNiq AbY ieh ho bDu hI kirhO ]1879]
transliteration: Ghan(i0 Syaam Sabhai San Jaadav San Jaadev Lai Taj(i) Yaah Kahai Na Bhayaa Tariho|| Kabi Syaam Kahai Mouslieh Bhant(i) Abai Eh Ho Badh(u) Hikarihau||1879||
translation: “Even if Krishna asks me taking all the Yadavas alongwith him, then also I shall not let him be alive,” Balram said thus, “I shall kill him just now.”1879.

gurmukhi: suin BUp hlwXuD kI bqIXw Apuny mn mY Aiq hI fru mwnXo ] mwnuK rUp lKXo n blI inhcY bl kau jm rUp pCwnXo ]
transliteration: Soun(i) Bhoop Halaayudh Kibateeyaa Apoune Man Mai At(i) Hidar(u) Maanyo Maanoukh Roop Lakhyo Na Balinihchai Bal Kau Jam Roop Pachhaadyo||
translation: Hearing the words of Balram, Jarasandh became extremely fearful; and he saw Balram, not as a man, but only as Yama;

gurmukhi: sRI jdubIr kI Er icqY qij AwXuD pwien so lptwnXo ] myrI shwie kro pRB jU kib sXwm khY kih Xo iGiGXwnXo ]1880]
transliteration: Srijadoubeer Kior Chitai Taj(i) Aayudh Paain So Laptaanyo|| Merisahaae Daro Prabh Joo Kabi Syaam Kahai Kah(i) Yo Ghighiyaanyo||1880||
translation: Now the king, looking towards Krishna, abandoning his weapons clung to his feet and said while crying, “O Lord! protect me.”1880.
